item.description: Come explore the Case Brothers historic district and take a 3-mile hike to the summit of Case Mountain in the Highland Park section of Manchester. We will see a waterfall, stone walls, carriage path, and Case mansions, as well as forest and ponds. Wear sturdy shoes or sneakers and expect some wet spots, very steep climbs, and bumpy terrain. The hike and commentary will take about two hours. Participants in this moderately paced (but strenuous) hike will learn basic hiking skills and, depending on the weather, view the Hartford skyline from the summit of Case Mountain. We will view property owned by the Town of Manchester and by the Manchester Land Conservation Trust. Led by Susan Barlow. Hike starts at the Spring Street trailhead: From Hartford, take I-84 eastbound to I-384, exit 4, right off exit ramp. Follow Spring Street down a curve and then down a steep hill, over a one-lane bridge. Parking along one side of Spring Street, with a little parking at the trail head. Extreme weather cancels. No dogs, please.

item.name: Highland Park History Hike
